projectPurpose: To provide a modern, comprehensive, and user-friendly network diagnostic tool for troubleshooting connectivity and performance issues by combining and enhancing the functionalities of traditional tools like ping, traceroute, and MTR, offering deeper insights, better visualization (via TUI), and more control across various platforms.
mainFeatures: Combines functionality of traceroute and ping
Modern, cross-platform, feature-rich alternative to MTR with a fancy TUI
Supports multiple protocols: ICMP, UDP, TCP over IPv4 & IPv6
Provides per-hop statistics (sent, received, loss%, RTT stats, jitter, status)
Supports Equal Cost Multi-path Routing strategies (classic, paris, dublin)
Interactive GeoIp world map and ASN lookups
Highly customizable TUI and tracing options
Forward and reverse packet loss analysis

alternatives.name: traceroute / tracert
mainFeatures: Maps the network path to a destination
Helps locate points of delay or failure

alternatives.name: MTR (My Traceroute)
mainFeatures: Provides real-time statistics (packet loss, latency) per hop
Displays results in a table format
alternatives.website: N/A (Often distributed via OS package managers)

alternatives.name: Wireshark
mainFeatures: Captures and interactively browses network traffic
Deep inspection of hundreds of protocols

marketPositioning: Trippy is positioned as a modern, advanced, and highly customizable command-line/TUI network diagnostic tool that builds upon the foundation of traditional utilities like ping, traceroute, and MTR. It offers a richer feature set than standard MTR, including advanced ECMP support, forward/reverse loss analysis, jitter measurement, and enhanced visualization, while remaining open-source and cross-platform. It targets network professionals and power users who need detailed network path and performance analysis capabilities beyond what basic built-in tools provide, differentiating itself from comprehensive enterprise monitoring suites by its focus on direct, on-demand diagnostics via a powerful terminal interface.
